text:
I wanted the mod_autoindex to use cascading stylesheets
to better fit into my site. I've made a simple patch to
allow this functionality by adding new directive 
StylesheetFile. It would be nice if it propagates
into the module.

There's a directive called HeaderName. In conjunction with IndexOption 
+SuppressHTMLPreamble you can style your directory index in nearly every way you want. It is far 
more flexible than your suggestion.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text: psychosos@gmx identified a much more flexible solution to this report.

creator: binary_runner@yahoo.com
text:
Using solution with "ReadmeName XYZ" and "IndexOptions +SuppressHTMLPreamble"
does not solve the problem for me. I would have to place the XYZ to every
directory I need to style apply to and I lost the auto-generated header with
directory name.

I would not call it more flexible ...

No.  ReadmeName can take an absolute url-path as in
